name: HIP 67851
scenarioDescription:
The HIP 67851 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HIP 67851 is a star with 1.63 times the mass of the Sun, and 5.92 times its radius. It is located 215.13 light years away from the solar system.

HIP 67851 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HIP 67851 system


HIP 67851 b

HIP 67851 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.46 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 67851 b is 438.84 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HIP 67851 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HIP 67851 c

HIP 67851 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.82 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HIP 67851 c is 1901.64 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HIP 67851 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HIP 67851, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
